intro: Selenipedium × stella, commonly known as the star selenipedium, is a rare hybrid orchid native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and green. The plant prefers shaded, humid environments and thrives in well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Its flowers are often arranged in a spiral pattern, giving it a unique and striking appearance. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is a challenging plant to cultivate outside its native range.
